abstract: Osram Sylvania and Philips plan to sell energy-efficient LED bulbs this year that can replace a 60-watt bulb, the most commonly used incandescent lamp.
snippet: Osram Sylvania and Philips plan to sell energy-efficient LED bulbs this year that can replace a 60-watt bulb, the most commonly used incandescent lamp.
lead_paragraph: The prospects of replacing today’s inefficient incandescent light bulbs with long-lasting, low-power LEDs are increasing.

headline.main: LED Bulbs for the Home Near the Marketplace
headline.print_headline: LED Bulbs Strong Enough For Reading Are Imminent
